title: East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: finale of the mysterious land of green ginger .
grimsby and humber seafood 'concerns ' after brexit .
pettit 's customers to discover if they 'll get their money back .
drug and alcohol crack down in grimsby .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today .
we will be back with more live coverage on monday from 08:00 .
in the meantime here 's five things we did n't know when we got up this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : rain expected overnight
text: cloud will increase this evening with outbreaks of rain spreading northeastwards .
the rain will be heavy for a time but turn lighter as it clears to the south by dawn .
light southwest winds and a minimum temperature of 6c ( 43f ) .
tomorrow will see a mostly sunny day with occasional showers in the west .
feeling chilly in brisk northwesterly winds .
a frost is expected to form during the evening and overnight .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: staff shortages blamed for delays in treatments in bridlington
text: hospital officials say a temporary shortage of consultants is to blame for disruption to rheumatism services in parts of east yorkshire .
the services affected are provided by the york teaching hospital nhs trust , at bridlington and scarborough hospitals .
the trust says things should start to get back to normal before christmas , but patient james wharne from driffield , says the trust has handled the problem badly
they are cutting back all the time .
it makes me feel we are being pushed aside they should have written and told us .
it makes us feel that owing to demand and we 're getting older that it 's rationing .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: here 's tonight 's look north headlines with peter levy
text: @ peter levy with a preview of our 6.30 friday programme on @ twitterid
the only answer to fly tipping is that councils should stop charging people to dispose of rubbish especially small business they are spending more money than they are bringing in
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: hull city owners ask for fans 'amnesty '
text: hull city vice-chairman ehab allam asks fans to stop 'unacceptable ' protests against his family 's ownership of the club .
some tigers fans threw balls on to the pitch in last month 's home defeat by nottingham forest after a protest march before kick-off .
many supporters are unhappy with the way the championship club is being run by ehab and his father assem .
ehab reiterated that they are keen to sell , but until they do , they are asking for an `` amnesty '' from fans .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: egypt briton 'had no idea drug was banned '
text: a shop assistant from hull who 's being held in an egyptian jail on drug smuggling charges has told the bbc she did n't know the pills she was carrying were banned and that she 's desperate to come home .
laura plummer , 33 , is due in court on saturday accused of smuggling 300 tablets of tramadol , a painkiller that is legal in the uk but not in egypt .
ms plumber says they were given to her for her egyptian boyfriend 's `` back problems '' .
local police says that ignorance of the law is no excuse .
her relatives hope the judge at her custody hearing in the red sea resort of hurghada on saturday will believe she made an innocent mistake drug smuggling can be punishable by death in egypt .

documents.title: watch : see how peter levy gets on feeding the tigers
text: peter levy has a week of challenges ahead of him to raise money for children in need .
it will include tandem bike rides , selfie challenges , ballroom dancing and pole dancing , but today for his first challenge he 's had to be very brave he 's feeding the tigers :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: calls to adopt more family groups
text: adoption agencies across east yorkshire and lincolnshire say they 're struggling desperately to find families that are willing to take in siblings .
more than half of the children currently waiting to be adopted in the area are brothers and sisters .
one woman separated from her own family as a teenager has told look north that it 's led to years of heartache .
adoption agencies say it 's important that brothers and sisters remain together , but that 's not always possible
nationally , just under half of children up for adoption are part of sibling groups .
in lincolnshire it 's slightly higher at 50 % .
in yorkshire and the humber 61 % of children are up for adoption with brothers or sisters .
author: Kate Sweeting
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: two charged with beverley jewellers burglary - police seeking a third
text: two me have been charged with the burglary of a jewellers in beverley .
watches , jewellery and charms were among the large amount of stock that was taken from the hugh rice shop on saturday market in the early hours of monday morning .
ian billany who is 39 and lee rose who 's 37 both of morpeth street in hull appeared at hull magistrates court this morning .
they 'll appear at hull 's crown court early next month .
police are still looking for a third man believed to be involved in the burglary :
police say brands of jewellery stolen include pandora , nomination charms and thomas sabo .
olivia burton ladies watches and michael kors mens and ladies watches were among the items taken .
police are asking anyone with any information to contact them on the 101 number .
or you can call crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .
a cash reward of £ 1,000 is being offered for information leading to a positive result .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: giants ' parade takes to city streets
text: giants ' parade takes to city streets

documents.title: sport : grimsby town 's latest
text: grimsby town goalkeeper james mckeown says as frustrating as their recent goal scoring record is , they had to become more defensively solid .
the mariners have drawn nil-nil for three of their last four league games .
mckeown believes their 4-1 defeat at mansfield showed something had to change .
meanwhile siriki dembele and danny collins have missed out on the pfa player of the month award for october , that went to luton town 's danny hylton .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: it 's looking like a marvelous day across our region
text: here 's some of the our weather watchers have sent us from across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire today :
if you want to get in touch with your stories of you can email us or contact us by facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull kr looking for new signings from overseas
text: hull kingston rovers assistant coach james webster admits targeting overseas signings could become a bit easier for them after the world cup has finished .
tim sheens is currently scouting in australia at the competition , but webster says a change in nrl rules will also mean a better chance to bring players to craven park .
there 's been a massive change with the salary cap in australia recently .
some clubs have over estimated what they thought that was going to be and are now looking to shed players .
after this week a whole heap of players will become eligible for uk visas and this brings a massive amount of people available to gain entry next year to our competition . ''
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: take a look at this : dance to remember
text: the way we were exhibition at hull station is really striking .
but it 's not just an exhibition .
tomorrow there will be a live dance performance to commemorate remembrance sunday and celebrate the few remaining veterans who were involved in the war .
the performance will take place on the main concourse at paragon station and will feature volunteers and school children from the area .
the way we were is being performed tomorrow , 11 november at 11:05 , 12:00 , 14:00 and 15:00 .
author: James Hoggarth
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sport : scunthorpe united team news
text: scunthorpe united midfielder clayton lewis is unlikely to be available for the iron until after their league trip to northampton next weekend .
lewis is away with the new zealand squad for their world cup qualifying play-offs against peru , but he will have to travel a combined 24,000 miles .
manager graham alexander says as a result lewis will probably miss out at sixfields , but admits he 'll probably come back refreshed .
and ready to perform for them in a couple of weeks time .
meanwhile scunthorpe united will be ball number 8 in tonight 's draw for the last 32 of the efl trophy ; that 's due to take place around 6.30
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: flooding possible at bridlington 's south pier
text: a flood alert is in place for the high tides around bridlington today .
that means flooding is possible so be prepared .
wave over-topping of the sea wall and wind blown spray may cause localised flooding between 19:30 and 23:00 and also saturday morning 08:00 and 13:30 .
there is particular concern for bridlington 's south pier .
similar conditions are expected on saturday evening and sunday morning .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: peter 's seven challenges in seven days
text: the children in need seven challenges in seven days is being launched tonight .
look north 's peter levy will be feeding big cats at the lincolnshire wildlife park .
it marks the start of seven challenges in the run up to children in need on friday 17 november .
peter 's second challenge is a tandem bike ride with weather presenter abbie dewhurst totalling 80 miles over the two days .
tomorrow peter and abbie will tandem their way from hedon to hornsea and on sunday it they will head to beverley .
here 's a map of their route :
if you ca n't make it and would like to show your support , you can donate £ 5 to bbc children in need .
simply text peter to 70405 .
texts cost £ 5 plus your standard network message charge and 100 % of your donation will go to bbc children in need .
you must be 16 or over and please ask the bill payer 's permission .
for full terms and conditions and more information visit bbc.co.uk/pudsey .
cheques , made payable to bbc children in need , can be sent to bbc , queens court , queens gardens , hull .
hu1 3rh .
'that 's right , that 's right , that 's right , that 's right you 're gon na love this tiger feat ' as @ twitterid faces his first of seven challenges for @ twitterid feeding tigers @ twitterid
feel sorry for the tiger if it upsets peter
peter looks like someone has asked him his true age .
@ twitterid have you seen this ?
thanks for your regular excellent forecasts !
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: rugby : hull fc 's minichello fails to lead italy to a world cup win
text: hull fc 's mark minichello could n't prevent italy from being knocked out of the rugby league world cup this morning , after their 38-10 defeat by fiji .
minichello captained the side , and despite a try from former hull kr outside back josh mantellato , italy have now exited the competition and fiji move on to the quarter finals .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: grimsby and humber seafood 'concerns ' after brexit
text: a representative of the seafood industry in north east lincolnshire says he wants the government to look at giving them free trade status in the ports of grimsby and immingham .
it 's ahead of the latest round of leave negotiations between the uk and eu which get under way today .
the government wants to put the day britain leaves the european union into law .
it 'll be 23:00 on the 29 march 2019 .
simon dwyer from the cluster group seafood grimsby & humber told the bbc he has many concerns about brexit .
he says around 5,000 people work in the seafood processing industry across the region and most of that seafood is imported from places like canada , argentina , south africa and china .
mr dwyer says they are working closely with defra and are asking for tax exemptions so they can take advantage of brexit and make it work for the industry .
he adds , some areas of concern about how brexit will work for the region 's seafood industry are access to overseas labour , overseas exports and trade quotas .
he says they will have to work hard with government to keep the region 's 5,000 seafood jobs .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: warnings that gender pay gap will 'take 100 years to close '
text: north lincolnshire has the highest gender pay gap in our region .
campaigners highlight 10 november as the point in 2017 when a woman on an average wage stops being paid relative to their male counterparts .
here 's what the pay gap looks like across the country :
in north lincolnshire men earn £ 3.26 per hour more than women .
the gender pay gap here is 24.4 % .
campaign group the fawcett society say progress in closing the pay gap has `` stalled '' and warns the gap in pay between men and women will take 100 years to close .
the government has introduced a legal requirement for all large employers to publish their gender pay and bonus data by april 2018 .
there are no excuses , employers now need to get on with the job of publishing their pay gap and pledge to improve workplace equality ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fancy watching a film under the stars ?
text: if you like the idea of sitting outside watching a film then cleethorpes could be the place for you .
that 's because an outdoor cinema could be coming to the resort next year .
the man behind the idea has told us it 's early days but he 's working on plans to show a number of films in the resort .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: pettit 's customers to discover if they 'll get their money back
text: customers who lost money after one of grimsby 's oldest firms went out of business will find out today whether they might get their money back .
pettit 's butchers had been in the town for 125 years and today a creditors ' meeting will discuss what happens next .
lots of people , like phil frejiszyn paid into a christmas saver scheme for their meat and hampers :
i 'm not very hopeful .
i do n't really think that us at the bottom of the pile are going to see any benefit from this meeting .
there 's a lot more investors , who 've got a lot more money to come back than us .
people who supply the meat , who are at the top of the list .
i think we are at the bottom . ''
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: finale of the mysterious land of green ginger
text: giant puppets and street performers will be marching through the streets of hull tomorrow as they mark the finale of a major city of culture event .
more than 50,000 people have turned out to watch previous parts of the land of green ginger which have been performed so far this year .
the parade will start at 18:30 tomorrow at saville street and weave along guildhall road , lowgate and high street before finishing at humber street at around 21:00 .
but as you can expect with a parade , there 'll also be road closures .
saville street is closed from today until 21:00 tomorrow , but you can still get to the shops .
guildhall road is also closed today until 21:00 tomorrow .
the rest of the road closures are starting tomorrow and you can find them on the city of culture website .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drug and alcohol crack down in grimsby
text: drug-taking , drinking and anti-social behaviour have been causing problems in grimsby town centre in the last few months .
joint patrols by north east lincolnshire council , humberside police and foundations drug and alcohol services have been carried out near the riverhead .
after only a week of patrols , foundations say they 've seen an increase in referrals for people using their services .
the council says their campaign seems to be working but paul hamilton who runs a cafe in the riverhead area says more still needs to be done :
a drunken person comes in , you try and get him out , he abuses you .
i 've been spat at , i 've been kicked .
the initiative has been good so far , but it 's got to keep going . ''
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: what 's the weather have in store for today ?
text: want to know whether to take a brolly or some sunglasses out with you today ?
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning .
gill here with all your updates on your news , sport , travel and weather across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire on friday 11 november 2017 .
it looks like it should be a nice bright day ahead as this from one of our weather watchers shows :
if you want to get in touch with your stories or you can email us or get in touch through facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five things we did n't know this morning
text: that 's all from me for today .
i 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 but all your breaking news will continue to be posted here overnight .
before i go , here are five things we did n't know thins morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dragons den style competition brings two new retailers to grimsby
text: two business-savvy entrepreneurs have faced the dragons and been hired in grimsby .
they 'll be opening their doors at grimsby 's freshney place in the coming weeks after both were judged to be winners in the shopping centre 's annual `` apprentice retailer '' competition .
boot room and house of monica are being given six month tenancies with no rent , rates or service charges to pay .
they 'll also get advice and support from business experts at the center .
former footballer lee shakespeare has lived in grimsby for almost 20 years and is the man behind boot room which sells top quality branded football boots .
monica atkin plans to open house of monica , selling vintage designer clothing , with brands like versace , christain dior and gucci
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: look north 's headlines with peter levy :
text: @ peter levy with a preview of the 6.30 news on bbc one ( east yorks and lincolnshire )
kudos to the organ donor boys .
unless you 're an egyptian pharaoh , or still believe in iron age notions of bodily resurrection , why would n't you donate your organs after death ?
it 's your moral duty as a human being & the ultimate act of recycling !
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : here 's kofi with what 's on in hull this week
text: a jazz festival , a literature festival and a spectacular parade what more could you want ?
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: solargate lights up queen 's gardens
text: a controversial sculpture that cost nearly a third of a million pounds has been officially opened in hull today .
the solargate was installed in queen 's gardens back in august after planning permission was refused for its original location .
earlier the sculpture was lit up for the first time :
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Local Live, Hull

documents.title: the perfect 65th birthday present ? a night out in grimsby
text: the perfect 65th birthday present ? a night out in grimsby
author: Matt Newsum
BBC Sport

documents.title: i 'm feeling all autumnal - here 's why :
text: if you want to get in touch with your or stories you can email us or get in touch by facebook or twitter .
or you can become one of the bbc 's weather watchers .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: and the winner is humber street !
text: humber street in hull has won the `` great street award '' .
the academy of urbanism awards said it was the long term regeneration of the area that had been the winning factor , by turning it into a new urban village .
judges highlighted the industrialisation of the area which had kept hold of the original character but allowed new start up businesses to develop .
they also point to the development of the theatre in the dock and the humber street partnership 's support of events like the freedom festival and the sesh .
the recession brought misery to many places but some used it to their advantage by scaling back plans to a more local level .
humber street fruit market did just that by cultivating local creative industries to kick-start the rejuvenation of this whole area , emanating from humber street .
the city council , local businesses and developers have all worked together to produce a very impressive , vibrant street . ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man found on flamborough beach named by police
text: the man who 's body was discovered by school children on a beach at flamborough earlier this week has been named .
alan timms had lived in bridlington since 2010 .
secondary school pupils from dundee high school in scotland were on an annual geography field trip when the discovery was made at selwick 's bay on monday .
the school say staff immediately moved the children away from the site and called police .
the death is not thought to be sus but police are asking anyone who spoke to alan over the past two weeks to contact them so they can piece together his movements before he died .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: banging the drum for hull
text: a group of hull 2017 volunteers are learning to play the drums in order to play one of tchaikovsky 's most well known pieces .
later this month the hull philharmonic orchestra are to perform a concert at hull city hall .
as part of it they will play the 1812 festival overture , during which the volunteers will play the famous drum section .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : weekend weather forecast
text: here 's my look at the weather for the rest of the day and a look ahead to the weekend :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: a house in grimsby could be yours for 18 bitcoins !
text: artist sean atkinson has decided to sell his unusual home using the online currency bitcoins and he 's had some interest already .
the home in welholme road is worth about £ 80k sterling .
it 's not just your run of the mill sale and it 's not a run of the mill house , it 's decorated with beautiful paintings which adorn its walls and ceilings .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: report says regions police force is getting better
text: humberside police has been told it needs to improve but is getting better .
that 's from a new report by a government watchdog , hm inspector of constabulary , which looks at how well our forces are doing when it comes to keeping us safe , and reducing crime .
the peel report gave our force a grading of requiring improvement .
it says humberside police needs to work on understanding the demands for its services and use of resources but says it has got better since 2016 and is good at planning for the future .
humberside police say they are pleased the report recognises the progress they have made over the last 12 months and will continue to work towards improving the service .
of course there 's always more to do , and this inspection provides us with some useful pointers .
we have worked hard to make some significant progress in the last 12 months and are pleased that the hmic has recognised this in their report .
although the overall grade remains the same as last year , it 's clear from the commentary how far we 've come . ''
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: pioneering campaign is recognised in lifestyle awards
text: two teenagers from north east lincolnshire have won an award for their campaign to get the policy on organ donation changed .
currently people have to opt in to donate their organs after they die .
but ben and tyler are urging the government to support an opt out system as ben 's dad urgently needs a lung transplant .
last night the teenagers won the senior age catagory for humberside police 's lifestyle awards .
the awards celebrate the work of young people and adults in their communities .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: take a look at the future of cleethorpes
text: you can have a look at plans to improve cleethorpes today .
the £ 7.2m regeneration scheme includes removing vehicles from part of seaview street as well as a restoration of some of the town 's victorian features .
the proposals are on display between 14:30 and 19:00 at cleethorpes library and online .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: union 'determined ' over bae manufacturing in brough
text: a leading member of the unite union will speak to workers at bae systems in brough today over their fight to keep their jobs .
as part of a bae re-organisation , 400 posts are expected to go at the brough site , which makes parts for the hawk jet .
unite assistant general secretary steve turner will talk about his determination to make sure manufacturing continues in brough .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: checkatrade trophy : three sunderland fans make trip to grimsby town
text: just three sunderland fans made the 154-mile journey down the east coast to watch their under-21s in the checkatrade trophy , according to hosts grimsby town .
sunderland , who were relegated from the premier league last season , are bottom of the championship and managerless , after sacking simon grayson on 31 october after 18 games in charge .
grimsby fans also stayed away from the game at blundell park , with the league two side tweeting that their attendance was 248 , way down on a ty crowd of more than 4,000 .
although grimsby tweeted that there were only three away supporters , the sunderland echo more than doubled that figure and reported that seven fans made the trip .
former england midfielder jack rodwell and fa cup winner callum mcmanaman were in the sunderland team who won 7-6 on penalties , with sean mcallister missing the decisive spot-kick for the mariners .
the group h game had finished 1-1 after 90 minutes , with jj hooper putting grimsby ahead from the penalty spot , before donald love equalised a minute later .
tonight 's official attendance is : 248 , with 3 from sunderland (

author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: warnings over dating apps 'backmail '
text: there 's concern gay men in east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire are being targeted on dating apps by blackmailers .
radio humberside has been told criminals are using the apps to build up a rapport with the victims , then they threaten to `` out '' them to their family and friends if they do n't transfer money .
for some , it will be the first time their sexuality has been revealed in public .
chair of the hull and east riding lgbt forum , andy train , says the results can be serious :
it can be very scary , particularly if you have never told anybody , but you have shared your inner most feelings online with someone you perceive to be a friend ''
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: opening date for go ape at normanby hall
text: the region 's first go ape should be open by easter .
construction of the tree top adventure course at normanby hall country park is under way .
it will include 29 crossings , a tibetan bridge , tarzan swing and zip wires .
there will also be a smaller course for children .
the nearest go ape to northern lincolnshire is currently in sherwood forest in nottingham .
the new attraction is expected to bring in thousands of visitors and create 26 jobs .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: police want these men after armed robbery
text: cctv images have been released of two men police believe are responsible for an armed robbery at lloyds bank on newland avenue :
the robbery happened at around 16:30 on wednesday 1 november when two masked men , one with a knife demanded money from a cashier .
the men got away with cash .
no one was hurt in the robbery and now lloyds bank are offering a £ 25k reward for information :
police are asking anyone with any information to contact them on the 101 number or anonymously to crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: tourism could be worth £ 1bn to the region next year
text: i think it is safe to say hull 2017 has been good for tourism .
but business leaders are coming together in east yorkshire today to discuss how to make sure the good times continue beyond the city of culture year .
according to visit hull and east yorkshire the value of tourism to the local economy has gone up .
ten years ago it was worth an estimated £ 615m .
last year it was put at £ 797m and by next year , they say it should touch £ 1bn .
tourism bosses in hull say they need to focus on its future as a cultural city .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: solar gate to light up queen 's gardens
text: the controversial art work known as solar gate will be officially opened in hull today .
the tower , which stands in queens gardens , was originally proposed to be built near to the beverley gate remains , but it was redesigned and relocated .
tonight the sculpture will be lit for the first time at night .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : the morning 's weather forescast
text: it 's a dry start for most of us .
find out what the rest of the day holds with my full forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

thanks to anne in goole for sending in this lovely

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today .
i 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 but all your breaking news and travel will be updated here overnight .
before i go , here are five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a cold night ahead
text: it will be a dry and clear night at first but will turn cloudy with a few spots of rain or drizzle in places and lows tonight of 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow will see a cloudy , damp start , soon becoming dry and turning brighter with plenty of sunshine developing .
maximum temperatures tomorrow of 13c ( 55f ) .
friday will be mostly dry with sunny spells .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: hull boss going nowhere
text: hull city manager leonid slutsky has the backing of the club 's owners according to his agent and he is n't considering resigning .
the club are 20th in the championship table having lost their last three games .
some supporters blame the club 's owners for their position with players leaving in the summer following their religation and their replacements arriving late in pre-season or after it had started .
slutsky himself says he does n't have any answers to some of their problems but the club 's owners appreciate why they 're in their current plight according to his agent sandro varga .

he 's quoted in russian media saying the club management understands all the circumstances that do not allow slutsky to achieve results so the question of resignation of the coach is not even being considered .
there 's speculation slutsky is being linked to a move to chelsea , not as manager but as technical director .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: man dies after pocklington crash
text: an 86-year-old man has died after being hit by a van in pocklington .
it happened at just after 11:00 today on the balk near to sainsbury 's .
the road was closed for a number of hours .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: police want to speak to these men
text: police want to speak to these men about a burglary in east hull on monday 2 october .
officers are asking anyone with any information to get in touch on the 101 number or you can call crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: antonio carluccio : celebrity chef dies at 80
text: the celebrity chef and restaurateur antonio carluccio , who brought one of his restaurants to beverley , has died at the age of 80 , according to his agent .
he was known for the italian restaurant chain that carries his surname and for appearing on tv programmes , including the bbc two hit two greedy italians , alongside chef gennaro contaldo .
he wrote more than a dozen best-selling books and in 2012 launched his memoirs .
the restaurant chain has called him the `` godfather of italian cooking '' and said he will be `` greatly missed '' .
`` antonio was a much loved and respected italian cookery writer , cook , restaurateur , food expert and tv personality , '' a statement from the carluccio 's restaurant chain said .
`` it is n't just antonio 's name above our doors , but his heart and soul lives and breathes throughout our restaurants . ''
carluccio co-founded the high street restaurant chain carluccio 's in 1999 .
in 2007 , he received an obe from the queen for his services to the catering industry and in 2012 , he was awarded the aa hospitality lifetime achievement award .

documents.title: man jumps from first floor window in police pursuit
text: two men have been arrested on sus of supplying class a drugs after a police chase in scunthorpe .
the arrests were made today on frodingham road .
two houses were raided and at one a man jumped out of a first floor window and ran off before being arrested by police .
humberside police say operation sierra aims to reduce violent crimes , robberies and burglaries .
they 're asking people to come forward with information by either calling the 101 number or contacting crimestoopers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .

documents.title: could a youth club in beverley tackle anti-social behaviour
text: i 've been hearing from businesses and residents in part of beverley 's swinemoor estate who say they need help dealing with anti-social behaviour outside the samman road shops .
the traders say people are afraid to the visit the shops and takeaways after dark , because they find the groups of teenagers intimidating .
there has also been vandalism and antisocial behaviour and some are calling for a youth club to be set up in the area .
that 's something we need to look at sadly the youth club we had was underused and has been converted into a boxing club .
we need to speak to our young people about what they would like and some just want somewhere to hang around . ''
the police say anyone with any concerns should call them on the 101 number and they will respond .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: do you know who these men are ?
text: police want to talk to these two men in connection with an attempted robbery in bridlington :
it happened at the junction of victoria road and quay road just after midnight on 22 october as two women walked home .
police say two men approached them from behind and then one tried to grab a woman 's handbag .
the woman was dragged along the floor and was left with minor injuries to her head and knees .
police are asking anyone who may know the men in the to get in touch with them on the 101 number .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: yorkshire is getting an international football team
text: yorkshire 's international football team is to face teams from somalia , north america and the isle of man ( next year .
the group behind the idea , the yorkshire international football association , are bidding to join conifa , a federation that recognises areas with a unique cultural identity .
the yifa chairman philip heggerty , says the county will now host a tournament in may .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: scunthorpe steelworks could play a role in heathrow 's third runway
text: british steel in scunthorpe could be involved in building heathrow 's third terminal .
it 's been named as a potential site for a logistics hub , which will form part of the airports supply chain for the project .
parts would be pre-assembled at one of four hubs before being transported to london .
heathrow airport say the project aims to get skills and expertise from across the country as well as creating new jobs .
the third runway is described as one of britain 's largest privately funded infrastructure projects .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sport : hull city team news
text: hull city defender josh clackstone 's going on loan to national league halifax town , initially for a month .
the 21-year-old 's been a regular in the hull under 23 team this season and made it onto the bench for the first team at the weekend .
last season he spent time on loan at notts county .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: watch : tour bus becomes a homeless shelter
text: a luxury tour bus once owned by the legendary rockers status quo has found a new lease of life as a homeless shelter in london .

businessman mike moulds , from long riston near beverley , has sold the bus , with its twelve bunk beds , luxury leather seating and nightclub booth , to the london-based charity the outside project .
it will provide emergency accommodation to lgbt+ people as a mobile homeless shelter .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: public consultation for drax 's coal to gas power plans
text: plans for a gas-fired power and battery facility at a uk power plant have gone out to public consultation .
drax said it wanted to switch from coal-fired power generation to gas .
it notified the planning inspectorate in september about its intention to upgrade two of its coal-fired units and build a 200-megawatt battery storage at its site near goole .
last year , the government said it wanted to phase out coal power by 2025 in a bid to cut carbon emissions .
more than half of drax 's current output is from biomass after it switched three of its units to burning eco-friendly wood pellets in 2013 .
under the proposals , the power station said it would create a 3.6 gigawatt gas generation system and a new gas pipeline for electricity to be exported to the national grid .
drax ceo andy koss said the plans could secure the future of the plant beyond 2025 .
people living in drax , selby and goole have until saturday to view the proposals .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: grimsby town take on sunderland
text: grimsby town will show wholesale changes tonight for the dead-rubber checkatrade trophy tie with sunderland under 23s .
shaun mcallister and jamey osbourne are expected to make their first appearance of the season , while sam kelly and mitch rose are likely to be involved too following their more recent injuries .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: christmas in afghanistan
text: a charity in hull is hoping to fill hundreds of shoe boxes full of gifts for soldiers currently in afghanistan .
hull4heroes wants to send the presents to troops from the yorkshire regiment , and if possible to all 400 british soldiers stationed there , in time for christmas .
there 's a collection point at the tesco store at st stephens shopping centre .
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: john prescott 's son suspended from jeremy corbyn 's aide job
text: the son of former deputy prime minister john prescott has been suspended from his job as jeremy corbyn 's aide .
david prescott is being investigated by the labour leader 's office after he was suspended a few days ago , the bbc understands .
it comes amid widespread allegations of misconduct at westminster .
the labour party declined to give details on the reason for the suspension , but said : `` we do not comment on staffing matters . ''
i 'm told his suspension relates to his `` employment '' after allegations were received by mr corbyn 's office , but the nature of the claims have not been disclosed .
a former senior bbc tv news producer , mr prescott joined the labour leader 's office over a year ago , initially as a speechwriter before becoming a communications manager to the shadow cabinet .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingaccident closes road in pocklington
text: a pedestrian has been struck by a van in pocklington .
it 's not clear what , if any injuries may have been suffered the balk is currently closed and the emergency services are on the scene .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: boost to charity that saves lives at sea
text: the hornsea rescue boat charity is getting a donation of £ 4,0000 from the government .
it 's one of a number of donations being given to charities across the country .
it 's almost 25 years since the rescue boat was founded , in 1994 .
as well as saving lives off the east yorkshire coast , volunteers also do a lot of educational work around safety at sea .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: help at hand after fire attack on charity
text: you might remember we told you about a men 's mental health charity in hull that had almost all the tools and equipment it used destroyed , in what 's thought to be an arson attack .
well there 's some good news :
police and the fire service are trying to work out exactly what caused the fire at the men in sheds headquarters in oak road in north hull yesterday .
the organisation , which helps people feeling lonely by teaching them woodwork , says the damage is extensive .
we 've had an incredible amount of people come forward and offer support to @ twitterid after yesterday 's fire .
including a pledge of £ 1,000 from our friends sargent electrical !
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: have your say on busy beverley junction
text: proposals to dual part of the a164 at jock 's lodge , where it crosses the beverley bypass are going on show to the public for the first time today .
officials want to hear what people think of the various schemes , which are designed to reduce congestion .
a new road junction is planned linking the a164 and the beverley bypass .
here 's what the junction could look like :
the plans will be on show at beverley racecourse until 18:45 and then at morrisons in beverley on friday 10 november from 09:30 to 18:45 .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingdavid prescott suspended from job in the labour party
text: there are reports that david prescott , the son of former deputy prime minister john prescott and a key aide to jeremy corbyn has been suspended from his job in the labour leader 's office .
a labour spokeswoman said : `` we do not comment on staffing matters . ''
mr prescott has emerged as a key member of mr corbyn 's team , reportedly helping to write his speeches and preparing him to face theresa may at prime minister 's questions .
he stood as the labour candidate in gainsborough in the 2015 election , but lost to sitting conservative mp sir edward leigh .

he also failed to gain the nomination as the party 's candidate in hull west and hessle , earlier this year after former home secretary alan johnson announced he was standing down in june 's election .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: gas-powered plans for drax
text: drax power station wants to stop generating electricity from coal and switch to burning gas .
people living near the power station have the chance to look over the plans at meetings over the next few days .
the power station says it plans to stop burning coal completely in the next eight years .
here 's where you can view the plans :
wednesday 8 november , 16:00 -18:00 at selby town hall .
thursday 9 november , 11:00 -16:30 drax sports and social club .
saturday 11 november , 10.30 - 13:30 the junction , goole .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : operation christmas child
text: a north lincolnshire branch of a national charity needs your help to break a record .
operation christmas child in barton upon humber have set themselves the task of sending 2017 boxes to needy children this christmas .
but they are short of cuddly toys , toothpaste and soap .
take a look of this :
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: hull school : lest we forget
text: sirius academy north sent us this of their poppy display for armistice day .
they say it 's to encourage students to never forget our fallen servicemen and women .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east riding council 's leader - name cleared
text: the leader of east riding council has been cleared of any wrongdoing in connection with his council work .
a businessman and former friend had claimed stephen parnaby had improperly influenced planning decisions .
an inquiry revealed nothing to support the claim .
the east riding standards committee has unanimously agreed to take no further action .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: the decline of the high street
text: it 's five years since the government asked retail expert mary portas to review the state of our high streets .
as part of the project 12 towns in england , including market raisen in lincolnshire ( were given portas pilot status and money to try out new ideas .
now new bbc research suggests our town centres are actually getting smaller .
on average a shop closed once every 22 days in the 12 portas pilot areas .
harjeet johal who 's the former managing director of the retail chain clothing direct , says we ca n't stop the demise of the traditional town centre as more people shop online .
but one market town in north lincolnshire says it 's bucking the trend .
the brigg town business partnership say they only have one empty shop and that 's because it 's up for sale .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: strike action affects trains
text: strikes are taking place on rail services across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire today .
some trains are cancelled and others are being replaced by buses today .
members of the rmt union at northern have walked out for 24 hours in a long-running row over driver-only trains .
you can check to see if your train is running here .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : weather forecast
text: good morning , it 's going to be a cold but sunny day .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning , gill here with all the latest updates on your news , sport , travel and weather on wednesday 8 november 2017 .
i 'll be with you till 18:00 today so let 's start with this sent in by one of our weather watchers of an early morning 's fishing at bridlington :
if you want to get in touch with your or stories you can email us or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 5 things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today .
breaking news will continue to be updated here overnight .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather across east yorkshire and the humber .
before i go , here are 5 things we 've learned today .
have a great evening .
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: princess anne launches sailors childrens society 's new project
text: her royal highness the princess royal went to hull maritime museum today to launch the sailors childrens society 's 200 business club , of which she is patron .
it 's part of her visit to hull and east yorkshire .
princess anne 's first stop was at the trinity house maritime college , before visiting the maritime museum .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: 'fitmums ' nominated for volunteering award
text: local athletics club and charity , 'fitmums has been shortlisted in the coaching intervention of the year category at this year 's uk coaching awards .
the club offers athletics sessions to more than 850 members across hull , yorkshire and north lincolnshire .
its selection for this award recognises the volunteer 's achievements in getting more people participating in physical activity .
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your evening weather forecast
text: cloud and occasional rain will clear away east overnight , with some good clear spells developing from the west .
a widespread frost in rural parts by morning .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: 'superman ' launched at hull 's albert dock
text: a new tugboat was launched from hull 's albert dock this morning , to help manoeuvre some of the world 's biggest container ships .
superman , which will be based at immingham , is the most powerful tugboat on the humber .
the company that own it says it 's needed because of the ports ' thriving economies .
here 's the moment it was officially launched :
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: drugs , cash and weapons worth £ 30,000 seized from hull estate
text: police have recovered £ 30k worth of drugs , cash & weapons from hull 's great thornton st estate .
over the past four weeks , they have been targeting `` cross-border '' dealers , which are criminals who came into the city from elsewhere in the country to deal drugs .
during this time , 35 people have been arrested , and five misuse of drugs act warrants have been executed .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: petition against council plans to turn golf club into nature reserve
text: a campaign to keep a council run golf course open in north lincolnshire will reach parliament this evening .
the scunthorpe labour mp nic dakin will hand in a petition of over 1,500 signatures on behalf of campaigners who want kingsway gold club to stay open .
north lincolnshire council say the land was very poorly used as a golf course and want to turn it into a nature reserve .
author: Andy Comfort
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : warning over discarded fish hooks on victoria dock
text: residents on hull 's victoria dock say they are fed up of finding discarded fish hooks on the walkway left behind by `` disrespectful '' fishermen .
several of the hooks have been found by dogs , some causing injury .
jackie constable , who has lived in the area for 17 years , had to pull a fish hook out of her labrador 's mouth after he swallowed it .
she says it was an `` horrific experience ''
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more train services for cleethorpes
text: additional train services are to be introduced on the route between cleethorpes , sheffield and manchester .
it 's part of transpennine express ' major timetable change taking place on sunday 10 december .
the changes will include new morning trains ( 07:51 , 09:51 and 11:55 ) direct from manchester to cleethorpes ( via sheffield ) on sundays .
customers in cleethorpes will also be able to travel direct to manchester airport on 12:12 or 20:26 sunday services .
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: men in sheds hq fire : 'it 's a complete write-off '
text: almost all the tools and equipment used by a hull charity have been destroyed in what 's thought to be an arson attack .
police and the fire service are trying to work out exactly what caused the fire at the men in sheds headquarters this morning .
the organisation , which helps people who are feeling lonely by teaching them woodwork , says the damage is extensive .
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: the weather forecast this afternoon and overnight
text: outbreaks of rain accompanied by gusty winds are gradually spreading east .
later , the wind will ease everywhere and the rain will clear from western areas while lingering across the east .
rain , still locally heavy , will gradually move away eastwards this evening .
dry and clear conditions will follow across the region , allowing a widespread frost to develop :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: slutsky to join chelsea ?
text: hull city 's under-pressure head coach leonid slutsky is being linked with a key scouting role at chelsea .
the russian is among the candidates to replace michael emenalo as technical director following his departure at stamford bridge .
slutsky 's friendship with blues billionaire owner roman abramovich has been well-documented .
author: Mike White
Sports Reporter, BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: the latest headlines from the bbc 's hull newsroom so far this afternoon include :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school pupils discover man 's body on flamborough beach
text: secondary school students taking part in a geography field trip have found a man 's body lying on a beach at flamborough .
the discovery was made by a class from dundee high school during a trip to selwicks bay at about 1100 yesterday .
staff immediately moved the children away from the site and called police , according to the school .
the dead man has yet to be identified and his cause of death is still unknown , say police .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel update : traffic lights out on ferensway
text: pcsos are directing traffic at the junction of ferensway and anlaby road in hull after the traffic lights stopped working this morning .
log 66 - traffic lights are not working at the junction of ferensway and anlaby rd in hull .
pcso colleagues are on point duty .
thank you for keeping the traffic flowing
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: eviction threats see alcohol-related crime drop in spring bank
text: problem street drinkers in an area of hull are being threatened with eviction to try to reduce the impact they 're having on the local community .
a few months ago we heard about the problems that street drinkers and drug takers were causing in the spring bank area of hull .
local business owners told me customers were being put off as a result and some staff feared going into work .
humberside police says the move by some housing associations has had a big impact on the area , where alcohol related crime has fallen .
the force has increased patrols on the streets in recent months and worked closely with business owners to deal with the issues .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: morning headlines
text: the headlines from the hull newsroom this morning include :
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull 's men in sheds hq severely damaged by fire
text: four fire engines have been dealing with a fire at a site on oak road in north hull this morning .
the headquarters for mental health charity men in sheds has been severely damaged .
the charity supports men who feel isolated or lonely .
other charities and organisations are already offering their support online to try to replace what the charity has lost .
the police and fire service are investigating .
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: firefighters help north lincolnshire children to read
text: firefighters have turned up at a school in north lincolnshire - but for once , there is no emergency .
it 's part of the council 's words count project , which sees firefighters helping children with their reading .
it 's hoped the project will improve literacy levels in the area .
the firefighters remain on call while they read with the children , meaning they can fit it in around their normal work .
the youngsters love it - and so do the staff from humberside fire and rescue .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: review of £ 30m oil extraction plans
text: plans to extract millions of barrels of oil in north lincolnshire will be discussed at a public inquiry today .
egdon resources had hoped to extract up to 700,000 barrels from a single oil well at a site in wressle , estimated to be worth as much as £ 30m .

permission has been turned down by north lincolnshire council on a number of occasions due to environmental concerns , there is local opposition to the plans but the company insists the process is safe .
a public inquiry will discuss the proposals over the next few days .
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: royal visit for east yorkshire
text: princess anne will be visiting our area today .
the princess royal 's first stop will be to open the new hull trinity house maritime college on posterngate in hull city centre .
that will be followed by a trip to full sutton prison in east yorkshire .
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull 's hotels see city of culture benefit
text: the number of people staying in hull 's hotels has increased by 80 % over the past year , according to figures from online travel company expedia .
they say its down to people wanting to visit city of culture events and also reveal there has been an increase in international travellers .
i 've visited cornerbrook guest house in north hull this morning , and they tell me they have had people from all over the world visit this year .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: not quite as cold as yesterday morning , but blustery showers expected throughout the day .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: pavilion fire in north hull
text: firefighters are dealing with a pavilion fire in north hull this morning .
humberside fire and rescue service is advising people to avoid the oak road area just off clough road .
we 'll bring you more on this as we get it .
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: welcome to our live coverage across east yorkshire and the humber
text: good morning .
join us as we bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather across the county on tuesday 7 november .
i 'm hayley and i 'll be with you until 18:00 .
if there 's anything you 'd like to get in touch with me about , you can do so via email , facebook and twitter .
have a great day .
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: thank you for joining me today .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning with all the latest news , travel , weather and sport .
however updates will continue through the night .
if there 's anything you 'd like to get in touch about you can email us here .
in the meantime , let 's have a look at five things we did n't know at the start of the day
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: peter levy has your headlines on tonight 's look north :
a preview of our 6.30 programme with @ twitterid
perception drugs not prescribed for him so she a drug dealer full stop .
stop crying cause you got caught , i did n't realise rubbish .
any mention of last night 's fireworks at lucarlys ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: do you know these men ? they are wanted by police
text: police are asking for help in identifying the men shown in the cctv images below .
in the early hours of this morning the three men broke into hugh rice jewellers in saturday market place in beverley .
they fled the scene in a dark coloured bmw 1 series .
a large amount of jewellery was stolen including pandora charms , thomas sabo jewellery , olivia burton ladies watches and michael kors ladies and gents watches and jewellery .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the family of a woman arrested in egypt 'fear for her health '
text: the family of a woman from hull , who has spent a month in an egyptian jail accused of drug trafficking , say they 're worried about her physical and emotional well-being .
laura plummer was arrested last month after officials found hundreds of tramadol tablets in her suitcase .
her family says the prescription drugs were to help her egyptian partner with his back pain and say it was an `` honest mistake '' .
look north 's jill archbold has this report :
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: humber bridge 'humbertag ' celebrates second anniversary
text: to celebrate the second anniversary of the humbertag , the humber bridge board is giving away a tour to the top of the bridge .
the humbertag was introduced in november 2015 .
it allows motorists to drive through the tolls with a pre-paid account instead of having to search for change .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: caught on camera by a crime-fighting police lorry
text: police using heavy goods vehicles have been catching lorry drivers behind the wheel with less than highway code standards of driving .
the chap in the video below was filmed texting , with one foot resting on the dashboard .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull 's blue bins : if in doubt leave it out
text: if in doubt , leave it out .
that 's the message hull city council are trying to get across to residents .
these two show the scale of contamination found in blue recycling bins in just one hour .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: all in all , another brick in the wall
text: imagine the scene , 16,000 bricks in a room and a group of children and parents trying to find the one they designed .
the bricks , which were made by children aged under five , were part of a temporary exhibition .
this weekend children and their families were invited to collect their art work .
any that do n't find homes will be made into a permanent exhibition on humber street .
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sixth form college cutting courses due to lack of funding
text: a sixth form college in north east lincolnshire says the level of funding it receives is unsustainable .
it comes as a survey out today by the sixth form colleges association shows some colleges are having to cut subjects because of a lack of funding .
trevor way , the principal at franklin college says they need more money .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: lost emu roams around north lincolnshire
text: an emu , which has been reported roaming around the isle of axholme in north lincolnshire , has been captured today .
it 's not known where the bird came from .
farmer ted phillips captured the emu with the help of some passers-by and a police officer close to haxey primary school .
the bird is now safe and well on mr. phillips ' farm .
author: Andy Comfort
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your afternoon weather
text: staying mostly dry this afternoon with sunny spells throughout .
turning windy towards the evening .
highs of 8c .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: fire service takes 45 calls in one hour on bonfire night
text: humberside fire and rescue officers say they dealt with 45 calls in just one hour during bonfire night .
they took 45 calls about bonfires between 18:00 and 19:00 last night .
the fire service also had a police officer in the control room in case any events needed officers to attend .
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: exhibition highlighting impact war has on women opens in hull
text: a new exhibition highlighting the impacts of warfare on women and girls opens in hull today .
the installation , called torn , will be on display at the humber street gallery .
it features a collection of stories and accounts from women around the world .
artist lee karen stow began her journey in sierra leone and visited a number of countries , including vietnam and cambodia to speak to women and find out about their experiences .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman held in egypt over drugs made 'honest mistake '
text: the family of a woman from hull who has been arrested in egypt on sus of smuggling painkillers into the country say they 're desperate to bring her home .
laura plummer has been in prison for almost a month after tramadol tablets were found in her luggage .
she says she was taking them to her egyptian husband who has a bad back .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: changes to waste and recycling in north east lincolnshire
text: if you live in north east lincolnshire your rubbish collections change from today .
waste and recycling will be collected fortnightly on alternate weeks , a move which has proved controversial .
thousands of people signed a petition calling for bigger bins and the council is focusing on residents who do n't fill them properly .
deputy leader of north east lincolnshire council dave watson says they 've had no choice but to change things .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: power cut affecting hundreds in hull
text: people living in the hu3 and hu4 postcodes are without power this morning .
northern power grid says 200 homes are affected by an unexpected problem with cables in the area .
they hope power will be restored before 13:00 .
# powercut in hu3 / hu4 areas of # hull affecting over 800 customers - @ twitterid hope to have issue restored by 10.15am today
oh , is that why my tv ( on the south bank of the humber ) flickered off briefly ?
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : police hgv catches dangerous lorry drivers
text: an unmarked hgv has helped police in yorkshire catch more than 500 dangerous drivers in two years .
the lorry lets officers see into cabs and spot offenders like this driver near goole who was filmed checking his phone , with his right foot on the dashboard :
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: yorkshire mps call for 'fair share ' of transport cash
text: mps are expected to call later for a `` fair share '' of transport investment for yorkshire and the humber .
hull north mp diana johnson , who 's due to lead a debate in the commons tonight , thinks the north needs more money and power to help build a modern road and rail network .

the department for transport says it 's carrying out the biggest investment in transport for the north of england in a bid to help build the `` northern powerhouse '' and to deliver improved journeys for passengers .

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: a chilly start to the day with a frost in some places .
we 'll enjoy sunny spells for a time today , but that sunshine will turn hazy .
watch my full forecast below .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: our live coverage across east yorkshire and the humber
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live feed across east yorkshire & humber on monday 6 november .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if there 's anything you 'd like to get in touch with me about , you can do so via email , facebook and twitter .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live
